name: arrayFind
description: These functions searches the array for the specified object. Returns the index in the array of the first match, or 0 if there is no match.

params.name: object
params.description: The value you are looking for in the array. CF10+ or Lucee4.5+ support passing a closure function in this argument as well.

coldfusion.notes: CF10+ Added support for closure instead of object

lucee.notes: Lucee4.5+ Added support for closure instead of object

examples.title: Find an "apple" in an array of Fruit
examples.description: Returns the index of the element "apple" in the array

examples.title: Member Functions: Find an "apple" in an array of Fruit
examples.description: Calls the find member function of the array object. Requires CF11+ or Lucee4.5+

examples.title: arrayFind is Case Sensitive
examples.description: Case sensitive so "Apple" is not in the array, returns 0. Use arrayFindNoCase for case insensitive matching.

examples.title: Using arrayFind with a closure / callback function
examples.description: CF10+ Lucee4.5+ The arrayFind function passes each array value into the supplied function. The function returns a boolean, `true` if you found what you are looking for. The result of the arrayFind function is the index of the first matching array element found, or `0` if not found. Use arrayFindAll to return an array of all found item indexes.
